alert.note: Alert for Cascade Foothills in Lane County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 01 at 2:00AM PDT until April 02 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM EARLY THIS MORNING TO 11 PM PDT SUNDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 1500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 14 inches, heaviest above 2000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Cascade Foothills in Lane County. * WHEN...From 5 AM early this morning to 11 PM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will remain unseasonably low through Monday. Accumulating snow will be possible for elevations as low as 1000 feet, but the heaviest and most impactful accumulations will remain above 2000 feet.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
